name: Jewish Cracker Snacks
author: merri rosenthal
summary: My Jewish grandma used to make homemade cheese blintzes, which are crepes. I adapted this for my family as a snack. Making crepes can be tedious; these are wonderful.
ingredients: ¼ cup vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Stir together the cottage cheese, matzo meal, sugar, and salt in a bowl
Place about 1 tablespoon of the cheese filling onto a cracker, top with another cracker, and press down
Beat the eggs in a shallow bowl
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Dip both sides of each filled cracker in the beaten egg, then place into the hot oil
Pan-fry the cracker snacks on both sides until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes per side
